hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Fade on Stress-to-Neutral Transition Attempt
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes, if BTC experiences a violent -8% down move followed by a +6% recovery within 24 hours, creating a liquidity gap (price zone with minimal trading), fading the recovery move at the gap fill level (78.6% Fibonacci of the down move) will be profitable as market retests recent lows.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In stress regimes, violent moves create liquidity gaps. Market makers and algos often fade fills of these gaps, especially when funding remains negative (indicating persistent bearish sentiment). The 78.6% Fib level is a common rejection zone.
entry_conditions: Followed by +6% or greater recovery within 24 hours
Price approaches 78.6% Fibonacci retracement of the down move
Enter short at 78.6% Fib level with limit order

exit_conditions.take_profit: 61.8% retracement of the recovery move (partial) & prior low (full)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Daily close above the 78.6% Fib level + 1%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 50% of such gap fills in STRESS regimes lead to full recovery and continuation upward, bypassing the mean reversion.
